name: Dinosaur Ridge
description: A world-famous paleontological site and outdoor museum located near Morrison, about 20 minutes west of Denver, where visitors can see real dinosaur fossils and hundreds of ancient footprints preserved in the rocks of the Dakota Hogback. It’s part of the Morrison-Golden Fossil Areas National Natural Landmark and was where some of the first Stegosaurus and other dinosaur bones were discovered in the late 1800s, with the tracksite now ranked among the top in North America. The ridge features more than 300 fossil tracks, interpretive signs, and opportunities to learn about both Jurassic and Cretaceous-era life
cost_description: Guided Bus Tour: $20 for adults (ages 12+), $14 for children (3-11), ages 2 & under free. - Exhibit Hall standalone: $4 if not doing a bus tour. - Morrison Dino Pass (bus tour + exhibit hall in both Dinosaur Ridge & Morrison Natural History Museum): $34 adults, $22 children (3-11), 2 & under free.
what_to_expect: Expect a mix of self-guided and guided experiences including walking or biking the paved Dinosaur Ridge Trail, taking bus tours with stops at major fossil and track sites, and exploring exhibits and interpretive signage that explain the geology and prehistoric life of the area. Bring comfortable shoes, water, and layers, as much of the experience is outdoors along trails with varying elevation and limited shade.

subsites.name: Guided Bus Tour (English)
subsites.description: Guided bus tours feature stops at the Bone Bed, the Brontosaur Bulges, and the Dinosaur Tracksite. Brief talks at each site provide context for the fossils on the ridge. Includes a short walk on along the fossil trail.

subsites.name: Guided Bus Tour (Spanish)
subsites.description: Guided bus tours feature stops at the Bone Bed, the Brontosaur Bulges, and the Dinosaur Tracksite. Brief talks at each site provide context for the fossils on the ridge. Includes a short walk on along the fossil trail.

subsites.name: Private Guided Tour
subsites.description: Guided bus tours feature stops at the Bone Bed, the Brontosaur Bulges, and the Dinosaur Tracksite. Brief talks at each site provide context for the fossils on the ridge.

subsites.name: Guided Walking Tour
subsites.description: Join a small group for a guide-interpreted walking tour of several fossil sites across Dinosaur Ridge. Learn about the geology and natuarl history during this outdoor 1.5-mile paved walking tour.

subsites.name: Walk with a Geologist
subsites.description: (1.5 mile) guided walk across Dinosaur Ridge led by a professional or highly knowledgeable amateur geologist. In addition to the interpretation of the dinosaur track and fossil sites, the tour includes an in-depth discussion of the geology and changes to the Denver area through time. Learn how Colorado and North America fit into a global pattern of movements with the assembly of the supercontinent Pangea that allowed world-wide migration of dinosaurs resulting in the dispersal of fossils found today.

subsites.name: Self-Guided Walk
subsites.description: Features over 15 interpretive stops highlighting fossils, geologic formations, and dinosaur tracks. Interpretive signs lead you on this 1.1 mile (one way from gate to gate) outdoor walk along a paved road.

subsites.name: Main Visitor Center
subsites.description: At the Gift Shop: pick up maps for hiking, purchase tickets for shuttle bus tours and the Exhibit Hall, shop for unique souvenirs and buy snacks and drinks. Our Main Visitor Center Gift Shop is located at the Main Visitor Center, where you can purchase bus tour tickets, pick up a map, get more information and shop for souvenirs. Our gift shop features replicas of dinosaurs, books, posters, clothing, snacks, toys, rocks, minerals, crystals, and fossils.At the Dig Areas: small kids can dig for souvenir fossils in the Benton Seaway Box, bigger kids enjoy uncovering dinosaur fossils in the Backyard Bones pit, everyone loves taking photos with the dinosaur replicas, and giving Sluice Mining a try.

subsites.name: Exhibit Hall
subsites.description: The Exhibit Hall features paleo-murals, fossil replicas and real fossil bones of giant long-necked dinosaurs. Designed to simulate a walk through diverse environments at different prehistoric dates, it features five sweeping, back-lit murals.
subsites.costText: $5 | Free if you booked a tour.

name: Molly Brown House Museum
description: This preserved building is a beautifully preserved Victorian home-turned-museum in Denver that tells the story of Margaret “Molly” Brown—Titanic survivor, philanthropist, and early 20th-century activist—through original artifacts, period rooms, and engaging exhibits of her life and impact on Denver and beyond. Built in 1889 in an eclectic Queen Anne/Romanesque style, the house reflects the prosperity and social history of Denver’s Capitol Hill neighborhood in the late 1800s. The museum’s guided and self-guided tours illuminate Molly Brown’s activism, philanthropy, and role in women’s suffrage, going well beyond her Titanic fame
cost_description: General admission pricing; see website for details.
what_to_expect: When you visit, expect to step back in time as you explore multiple floors of period-furnished rooms and learn about the Brown family’s life and legacy—guided tours are highly recommended for deeper context. There’s no air conditioning, so dress comfortably, and plan around 1–2 hours to enjoy the house, exhibits, and gift shop fully

subsites.name: Guided House Tour (Standard)
subsites.description: Small-group docent-led tour through the home that focuses on Molly Brown’s life, activism, and the house itself.

subsites.name: Self-Guided Museum Visit
subsites.description: Explore exhibits and rooms at your own pace.

subsites.name: After-Hours / Cocktail / Lecture Event
subsites.description: Evening programs, talks, or themed events. View the link below for scheduling and availiabilites.

subsites.name: Red Rocks Museum

subsites.name: Red Rocks Hiking Trail

name: History Colorado Center
description: History Colorado Center is a major history museum in Denver dedicated to chronicling the rich and diverse story of Colorado—from its Indigenous roots and frontier days to modern cultural movements—through immersive, interactive exhibits. Opened in 2012, the center features a mix of permanent and rotating galleries that include artifacts, multimedia displays, hands-on experiences, and engaging storytelling across more than a dozen exhibitions. It serves as a hub for exploring Colorado’s environment, communities, innovation, and heritage in a family-friendly setting.
what_to_expect: At the museum, expect a dynamic experience with interactive displays (like a large state map you can “travel” through and simulated environments), a mix of historical artifacts and modern interpretive media, and special exhibitions that appeal to both adults and children. Comfortable shoes and a couple of hours are recommended, as the center’s multi-floor layout and breadth of content make for an engaging and explorative visit.
cost_description: Guided Bus Tour: $20 for adults (ages 12+), $14 for children (3-11), ages 2 & under free. - Exhibit Hall standalone: $4 if not doing a bus tour. - Morrison Dino Pass (bus tour + exhibit hall in both Dinosaur Ridge & Morrison Natural History Museum): $34 adults, $22 children (3-11), 2 & under free.

what_to_expect: When you visit, expect to step back in time as you explore multiple floors of period-furnished rooms and learn about the Brown family’s life and legacy—guided tours are highly recommended for deeper context. There’s no air conditioning, so dress comfortably, and plan around 1–2 hours to enjoy the house, exhibits, and gift shop fully

subsites.name: Public Guided Tour (Standard)
subsites.description: Tours are only sold a month in advance with 35 tickets per tour time. Please check back as future dates will be added. All tours begin at Gate D (20th & Blake Street). Tours cover a distance of approximately 1 mile. Please arrive 15 minutes in advance. All areas are subject to change depending upon weather, team schedule and ballpark maintenance. Only single-pocket, medical and diaper bags that are no larger than 16”x16”x8” can be brought into the ballpark and all permitted bags will be subject to search. Backpacks and other multi-pocket bags, including multi-pocket purses, are NOT permitted.
subsites.costDescription: Adults: $36.00 Seniors (55+): $21.00 Children (2-17): $11.00 Children (2 and under): FREE

subsites.name: Private Guided Tour
subsites.costText: Start at $400.00 for up to 25 guests. Each additional Adult: $15.00. Each additional Senior: $12.00 Each additional Child: $12.00. Groups smaller than 25 will pay the flat rate of $400

subsites.name: Happy Hour Private Tour
subsites.description: This tour will end at McGregor Square and include a drink voucher at Mile Post Zero.

subsites.name: Private Guided Tour
subsites.costText: Start at $250.00 for up to 25 guests.Each additional Adult: $10.00. Each additional Child: $7.00. Groups smaller than 25 will pay the flat rate of $250
